bunpro.meaning: Not only...but, Not just...but, What is more
bunpro.writeup: のみならずis a structure consisting of のみ, the literary particle equivalent of だけ meaning 'just' or 'only', the negative stem-form of the う-Verb なる 'to be', and theliterary auxiliary verbず, which connects with verbs in the same way, and carries the same meaning as ない. This expression indicates that something is 'not just (A), but also (B)', or 'not only (A), but (B) too'.のみ connects to words in the same way as だけ, so this pattern will be seen following Verbs, い-Adjectives, な-Adjectives, or nouns.Occasionally,のみならずmay function as a conjunction, appearing at the beginning of a new sentence. In these cases, the meaning is the same, but usually translates closer to 'what's more', 'furthermore', or 'moreover'.Caution - As this structure is formal, it will primarily be seen in literature, or heard in speeches.

examples.japanese: 今日は仕事に遅刻したのみならず、帰りの終電も逃してしまった。
examples.english: Today I was not only late for work, but also missed the last train home.

examples.japanese: 日本の夏は暑いのみならず湿気が高いから熱中症になりやすい。
examples.english: Japanese summers are not only hot, but also humid, making it easy to suffer heat stroke.

examples.japanese: あのパソコンは便利のみならず、安いので他のと比べてたくさん売れています。
examples.english: That computer is not only convenient but also inexpensive, so it sells a lot more compared to the others.

examples.japanese: この漫画は子供のみならず大人の間でも人気があります。
examples.english: This manga is popular not only among children, but also among adults.

examples.japanese: 田中さんは私の先輩だ。のみならず、命の恩人でもある。
examples.english: Tanaka-san is my senpai. Furthermore, he is the person that saved my life.

examples.japanese: 高橋さんはサッカーの専門家だ。のみならず野球にも詳しい。
examples.english: Takahashi-san is an expert on soccer. Moreover, he is also very knowledgeable about baseball.

examples.japanese: アニメや漫画は日本の国内のみならず国際的に絶大な人気を持つようになった。
examples.english: Anime and manga have gained enormous popularity not only in Japan, but all over the world.

examples.japanese: 発光ダイオードは蛍光灯よりずっと安いのみならず環境への影響も細小である。
examples.english: Light emitting diodes are not only much cheaper than fluorescent lights, but also their impact on the environment is miniscule.

examples.japanese: ボストン・ダイナミクスの新たなロボットは、速く走れるのみならず、ジャンプしたり、押されればバランスを取れたりする素晴らしい機械である。
examples.english: The new Boston Dynamics robot is a fantastic device that can not only run quickly, but is also able to do things like jump and regain balance if pushed.

examples.japanese: この大統領候補は、豊富な知識があるのみならず経験の深い人でもある。
examples.english: This presidential nominee is not only a person with abundant knowledge, but also is a person with vast experience.

examples.japanese: 喫煙は喫煙者のみならず周りにいる者、特に子供、お年寄りなどを肺がんにする可能性がある。
examples.english: Smoking has the potential to cause lung cancer not only for smokers, but also for those around them, especially children and the elderly.

dojg.description: A phrase that is used in formal writing to mean “not only”.
dojg.meaning: Not only ~ (but also ~); not only that

examples.japanese: (ksa).我が社は日本国内のみならず、アメリカやヨーロッパなどでもビジネス活動を行っております。
examples.english: Our company does business not only in Japan but also in  America, Europe, and elsewhere.

examples.japanese: (ksb).これからの企業は単に利益を追求するのみならず、環境に配慮した生産活動を行わなければならない。
examples.english: Today's companies should not just pursue profits; they should  also consider environmental protection issues in their production activities. (literally:  they must perform production activities that take the environment into  consideration as well.)

examples.japanese: (ksc).彼のしたことは人間として恥ずべきことである。のみならず、それは明らかに犯罪行為だ。
examples.english: As a human being, he should be ashamed of what he did. Not only  that, it is clearly a criminal act.

examples.japanese: (a).料金体系のみならず、サービス体制も改善する必要がある。
examples.english: It is necessary to change not only the fee structure but the  service system as well.

examples.japanese: (b).大統領の決定には国内のみならず、海外からも強い批判の声が上がっている。
examples.english: The president's decision is being criticized  heavily not only within the country but also abroad.

examples.japanese: (c).この会社は炭酸飲料メーカーとして世界的に有名であるのみならず、アメリカ合衆国を象徴する存在の一つでさえある。
examples.english: Not only is this company famous worldwide as  a carbonated beverage manufacturer, it is even an American symbol (literally: one of  the entities that symbolize the United States).

examples.japanese: (d).この種の犯罪は、老後の生活資金を根こそぎ奪うなど、市民への経済的な影響が甚大であるのみならず、精神的打撃も多大である。
examples.english: Crimes of this kind have an enormous impact on citizens, not  only economically but also psychologically, as they can completely deprive  citizens of their post-retirement livelihoods (among other things).

examples.japanese: (e).技術者は単に技術の進歩の推進者であるのみならず、人類・社会に及ぼす技術の影響についても強い責任感を持つ自律的な行動者であるべきである。
examples.english: Technology specialists should not simply play a role as  promoters of technological advancement; they should also be independent actors  who bear a heavy (literally: strong) sense of responsibility for the effect of  technology on people and on society.

examples.japanese: (f).不正軽油の製造・販売・使用は、極めて悪質な脱税行為である。のみならず、ディーゼル車の排気ガスは大気中の有害物質を増加させるなど、環境汚染の原因にもなっている。
examples.english: The production, the sale, and the use of illegal diesel oil are  extremely serious acts of tax evasion. Not only that, these acts result in  environmental pollution because they bring about an increase in toxic  substances in the atmosphere via the exhaust from diesel cars.

examples.japanese: (g).私はすっかり疲れていた。肩や頸の凝るのはもちろん、不眠症もかなり甚しかった。のみならず偶々眠ったと思うと、いろいろの夢を見勝ちだった。(芥川龍之介『夢』)
examples.english: I was totally exhausted. My shoulders and neck were stiff, of  course, and I was suffering from severe insomnia. Not only that, when I did  finally fall asleep, I had many dreams. (From Dreams by Akutagawa Ryunosuke)
